title: $580k Lotus Esprit S1 Restomod Coming Next Month With V8 Power

title: Porsche Carrera GT at 25: The Analog Icon That Still Defines a Supercar
description: When Porsche pulled the cover off its Carrera GT concept at the 2000 Paris Motor Show, few expected it to become one of the most celebrated supercars of the 21st century. By 2004, the road-going version was rolling out of Porsche’s Leipzig facility, carrying with it motorsport DNA and a purity of ...
titleSummary: "Supercar Time Capsule: How the Porsche Carrera GT Remains an Unbeatable Classic"
descriptionSummary: At the 2000 Paris Motor Show, Porsche unveiled its enigmatic Carrera GT concept, which would soon evolve into one of the most revered supercars of its era. The production model's arrival in 2004 was marked by a potent blend of racing heritage and sleek design simplicity.

title: Techart Just Turned the Porsche 911 Carrera T Into a 498-HP Rocket
description: The Porsche 911 Carrera T returned for the 2025 model year as a driving purist's delight, with a standard six-speed manual transmission, rear-wheel drive, and the lowest curb weight of any current 911 Carrera model. It's definitely a "less is more" car, so it seems like an odd target for the ...
titleSummary: "Porsche 911 Gets a Boost: Techart Transforms It into a High-Performance Beast"
descriptionSummary: The Porsche 911 Carrera T returns in 2025 as a driver's dream, boasting a lightweight design, rear-wheel drive, and a manual transmission that strips away excess weight and complexity, making it a refreshingly straightforward driving experience.

title: Tesla Bounces Back From Its Sales Slump, But Can It Keep the Momentum?
description: Tesla entered 2025 under pressure, with weakening demand and disrupted momentum. In particular, the second quarter of 2025 was a low point, as the company produced just over 410,000 vehicles and delivered approximately 384,000 units. That drop in deliveries from previous years illustrated the ...
titleSummary: "Tesla's Sales Revival: Can Electric Car Giant Sustain Its Resurgence?"
descriptionSummary: Tesla kicked off 2025 facing intense scrutiny, with dwindling demand and disrupted production momentum. The second quarter proved particularly challenging, with output of around 410,000 vehicles and a corresponding delivery total of roughly 384,000 units. This marked a notable decline in sales compared to previous years.

title: Faraday Future Prototype Went Up in Flames, Takes The Office With It
description: Faraday Future isn't exactly popular among EV buyers, with the California-based startup struggling to take off. Its flagship model, the FF 91, began a handful of deliveries two years ago, but only 16 units were sold as of early 2025. The company added a handful more in the first quarter of the ...

descriptionSummary: Despite its electric ambitions, Faraday Future has yet to gain significant traction among EV enthusiasts. Its flagship FF 91 model made a few sales a couple years back, but only 16 units changed hands by early 2025, with a small increase in the following quarter.

title: The Mustang Stands Alone—and Ford’s CEO Says It’s Here to Stay
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley knows what most people now know about the Mustang: it's sort of the last muscle car (sports car, really) standing among its original competitors from the early 1960s. Dodge has significantly altered the Charger's formula, and the Challenger name is dead. Chevrolet seems to have ...

descriptionSummary: Ford CEO Jim Farley acknowledges the Mustang's status as a remaining icon of America's classic muscle cars, a breed that once dominated the roads alongside legendary models like the Charger and Challenger.

title: Nissan Leaf Owners Shouldn't Fast Charge Until They Check For This Recall

descriptionSummary: Nissan has initiated a recall for certain 2021 and 2022 Leaf models due to a potential fire hazard associated with high-speed charging. The issue arises when the vehicle's battery overheats during rapid charging, posing a safety risk.

descriptionSummary: Mazda's high-performance offshoot is stepping up its pace, leveraging racing expertise to create driving dynamics that translate seamlessly from the track to public roads.

title: How ECU Locks Are Costing Ford the Mustang's Future
description: When the S650 generation Ford Mustang debuted, Ford locked down its engine control unit through its new Fully-Networked Vehicle electrical architecture. The suit alleges that the EV's 12-volt units drain rapidly, necessitating replacements ...

titleSummary: "Kia Cruises to Record US Sales, But SUVs Are Only Part of the Story"
descriptionSummary: Kia America achieves unprecedented sales success, shattering records for both quarterly and year-to-date performance. The company sold a record 65,507 vehicles in September, representing an 11% jump from the same period last year.
